name: remote-containers
description: Open any folder or repository inside a Docker container and take advantage of Visual Studio Code's full feature set.

untrustedWorkspaces.description: Opening a folder in a container requires workspace trust.

continueEditSession.qualifiedName: Continue Working in a Container Volume

dev.containers.defaultExtensions.description: Configures the list of extensions to always install while creating a container.

dev.containers.defaultFeatures.description: Configures the list of features to always install while creating a container.

dev.containers.workspaceMountConsistency.description: The consistency level used for the workspace mount (existing containers must be rebuilt to take effect).

dev.containers.cacheVolume.description: Controls whether a Docker volume should be used to cache the VS Code server and extensions. Currently only applies to single container and not Docker Compose configurations.

dev.containers.copyGitConfig.markdownDescription: Controls whether the Git configuration (`~/.gitconfig`) should be copied into the container. This is done after installing any `#dotfiles.repository#` and will not overwrite an existing Git configuration file.

enumDescriptions: Write to system config (`/etc/gitconfig`, requires root access).
Do not set a credential helper.
dev.containers.gitCredentialHelperConfig.description: Where to write the configuration for the Git credential helper.

dev.containers.logLevel.description: The log level for the extension.

dev.containers.dockerPath.description: Docker (or Podman) executable name or path.

dev.containers.dockerComposePath.description: Docker Compose executable name or path.

dev.containers.executeInWSL.description: Controls whether CLI commands should always be executed in WSL. The default is to only execute in WSL for workspace folders in WSL. This setting has no effect on other platforms than Windows.

dev.containers.executeInWSLDistro.markdownDescription: WSL distro to use when not reopening a WSL folder. The default is to use the default WSL distro (see `wsl -l`). This setting has no effect when `#dev.containers.executeInWSL#` is not enabled or on other platforms than Windows.

dotfiles.repository.description: URL of a dotfiles Git repository (e.g., https://github.com/owner/repository.git) or owner/repository of a GitHub repository.

dotfiles.installCommand.description: The command to run after cloning the dotfiles repository. Defaults to run the first file of `install.sh`, `install`, `bootstrap.sh`, `bootstrap`, `setup.sh` and `setup` found in the dotfiles repository's root folder.

dotfiles.targetPath.description: The path to clone the dotfiles repository to. Defaults to `~/dotfiles`.

dev.containers.repositoryConfigurationPa.markdownDescription: List of additional paths to search for [repository configurations](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-dev-containers/tree/main/repository-containers).

commands.title: Rebuild Without Cache and Reopen in Container
Clone Repository in Named Container Volume...
Clone Repository in a Container Volume
Clone GitHub Pull Request in Container Volume...
Explore a Volume in a Dev Container...
Checkout Pull Request in Dev Container
Reset Don't Show Recovery Container Notification

view/item/context.when: view == dockerVolumes && viewItem == volume && vscode-docker:aciContext != true

viewsWelcome.contents: Get started with containers by [installing Docker](command:remote-containers.installDocker) or by visiting the [help view](command:~remote.helpPanel.focus). [Refresh](command:remote-containers.explorerTargetsRefresh) after installation and startup.

Get started with containers by running one of the [Dev Containers](command:remote-containers.newContainer) commands.
You can [reopen the current folder in a container](command:remote-containers.reopenInContainer), or open another folder in a container.
[Open Folder in Container](command:remote-containers.openFolder)
If you're new to containers and want to [try a sample](command:remote-containers.trySample), there are several to choose from.

Get started with containers by running one of the [Dev Containers](command:remote-containers.newContainer) commands.
You can open an existing folder in a container.
[Open Folder in Container](command:remote-containers.openFolder)
If you're new to containers and want to [try a sample](command:remote-containers.trySample), there are several to choose from.

If there's a repository you want to work with you can clone that directly in a container volume.
[Clone Repository in Container Volume](command:remote-containers.openRepositoryInUniqueVolume)

scripts.vscode:prepublish: npx npm-run-all --npm-path npm clean definitions compile-prod dev-containers-user-cli-prepare
scripts.compile: npx npm-run-all --npm-path npm clean-dist definitions compile-dev
scripts.watch: npx npm-run-all --npm-path npm clean-dist definitions compile-watch
scripts.compile-prod: npx npm-run-all --npm-path npm compile-cli-prod copy-cli esbuild-prod
scripts.compile-dev: npx npm-run-all --npm-path npm compile-cli-dev copy-cli esbuild-dev
scripts.compile-watch: npx npm-run-all --npm-path npm --parallel compile-cli-watch watch-cli esbuild-watch
scripts.dev-containers-cli-prepare: npx npm-run-all --npm-path npm clean dev-containers-cli-compile dev-containers-cli-copy-module dev-containers-cli-copy-definitions
scripts.clean-dist: rimraf dist dev-containers-cli/dist dev-containers-cli/scripts dev-containers-user-cli/dist dev-containers-user-cli/scripts
scripts.copytestconfigsforalpine: /bin/bash -c 'cd test/configs && for f in *; do if [[ -d $f ]] && [[ $f != *alpine* ]]; then cp -r -T $f $f-alpine ; fi ; done'
